subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han compound|辶|元|c1=s|c2=p|t1=walk|ls=psc|no_och2=1}}.

Unorthodox variant {{Han simp|遠|f=袁|t=元|nocap=y}} found in various {{w|Movable type#Metal movable type in China|moveable type}} copies of {{w|Classic Chinese Novels|classical novels}}. First attested in 《{{w2|zh|宋元以來俗字譜}}》, a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant forms}} dictionary compiled in 1930 that records unorthodox forms ({{l|zh|俗字}}) that have existed since the {{w|Song dynasty}}.

Eventually adopted as an official {{w|Simplified Chinese|simplified character}} by the People's Republic of China in the 1956 {{w|Chinese Character Simplification Scheme}}. <!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/漢字簡化方案 -->

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: Found in the historical Chinese dictionary {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} 《{{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}》 compiled in 997 AD.
